com.yantra.api.omp.payment

Interface voidChargeTransaction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface voidChargeTransaction

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document voidChargeTransaction(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      This API is used to Void Charges collected.

    • Method Detail

      • voidChargeTransaction

        org.w3c.dom.Document voidChargeTransaction(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                           java.rmi.RemoteException

        This API is used to Void Charges collected. This API accepts a list of Charge Transactions as input and creates Void requests for them. Payment Types are configured as to whether they support Void or not.
        If Payment Type supports Void, then rather than following the standard refund process, the Charge will be Voided i.e. refund to the same Payment Method. This API will create a new Charge Transaction for every Charge Transaction that is requested for Void. The new Charge Transaction (Void request) will have the flag VoidTransaction set to 'V' indicating that it is a Void transaction. The new Void request will have the the same Payment Method and AuthorizationID as the original Charge Transaction that has been requested for Void. Request Amount for the Void request will be set as negative of Credit Amount of the original Charge Transaction. Void requests are created in OPEN status and are processed by payment agents. Void flag information is passed to the Payment gateway using the Collect user exits, so as to indicate that these payment transactions should be Voided.
        If Payment Type does not support Void, then the Charges will follow the refund rules of the Payment Type. Submitted Charges are grouped by Payment Method and refund logic is run to create Refunds. The Refunds created will have the flag VoidTransaction set to 'R' indicating that they are Refund requests. Refund requests will have the appropriate refund Payment method set on them. Refund requests are also created in OPEN status and are processed by payment agents.

        All the Charge Transactions that have been requested for Void, will have the flag VoidTransaction set to 'S' indicating that Void requests have been submitted for them.
        If the Charge Transaction that has been requested for Void is in OPEN status, then the transaction will simply be CLOSED.
        Only Charge Transactions whose Charge Type is CHARGE can be Voided.
        Charge Transactions whose Charges are distributed to an Invoice cannot be voided.
        If the Charge Transaction that has been requested for Void already has a Void or Refund request(completed or not), the API will throw an error.
        A Charge Transaction that is itself a Void or Refund request, cannot be Voided(VoidTransaction flag is either 'V' or 'R').
        Charge Transactions passed as input to this API should all belong to the same Order.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None
        Events Raised: None
        Audits: No.

        Pre-conditions:
        None

        Post-conditions:
        None

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: No.

        Parameters:
        env - Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is a mandatory parameter.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the Charge Transactions that have been requested for Void. For details on the output, refer to the associated output xml files.

        Throws:
        YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.


        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
